channel.title: Maths on Script Adults
channel.description: Recent content in Maths on Script Adults

item.title: Reinventing Catalan numbers
item.description: Counting binary trees I was thinking about of the problem of balancing a binary tree, and my mind stumbled across to the question “How many different binary trees with labelled nodes can you make without changing the traversal order?”. Afterwards I realized that the numbers of such binary trees are just Catalan numebrs (I was not really into combinatorics - now I am). For example, the following has traversal order 1->2->3->4->5->6->7

item.title: From casual description of Turing Machine to the density of uncomputable functions
item.description: Defining the machine by describing it In Sipser’s Introduction to the theory of computation, a alternative way of defining a Turing machine (other than defining the formal 7-tuple, which is a PITA) - by its “description”. Example (from the proof of $A_{TM}$ is deciable): M = â€œOn input <B, w>, where B is a DFA and w is a string: 1. Simulate B on input w. 2. If the simulation ends in an accept state, accept .
